relationships.evidence_text: Hi friends, welcome to the Y on Earth community stewardship and sustainability discussion series.
we have the opportunity to talk with Reverend Fletcher Harper from Green Faith.

as a preacher I'm curious if you have a favorite passage or two from the scriptures that that helps orient some of the work you are doing as it relates to stewardship of our world.
God is over and over again calling everything that God creates good during the first creation story.
God is over and over again calling everything that God creates good during the first creation story.
...and then get to the end of the of the week and looks at everything and calls it very good.
there's a very fundamental assertion there that that is about a gift that is given not just to us but to all of the created order.
it's a fascinating image because it's an image of a city the New Jerusalem.
it's a city that has a river flowing right down it's it's main street.
there are these beautiful life giving trees.
the leaves of the trees are for the healing of the nations.
we all depend on nature's healing and restorative and supportive power for our very lives.

that would grow naturally there but that were becoming increasingly rare across the the UK countryside
using religious properties as a way of modeling really exemplary behaviors
